destinations.name: Paris, France
destinations.longDescription: Paris, France's capital, is a major European city and a global center for art, fashion, gastronomy and culture. Its 19th-century cityscape is crisscrossed by wide boulevards and the River Seine. Beyond such landmarks as the Eiffel Tower and the 12th-century, Gothic Notre-Dame cathedral, the city is known for its cafe culture and designer boutiques along the Rue du Faubourg Saint-Honoré.

itinerary.title: Arrival & Eiffel Tower
itinerary.desc: Land in Paris, check-in, and visit the Iron Lady at sunset.

itinerary.title: Art & History
itinerary.desc: Explore the Louvre and walk through the historic Le Marais.

destinations.name: Bali, Indonesia
destinations.longDescription: Bali is an Indonesian island known for its forested volcanic mountains, iconic rice paddies, beaches and coral reefs. The island is home to religious sites such as cliffside Uluwatu Temple. To the south, the beachside city of Kuta has lively bars, while Seminyak, Sanur and Nusa Dua are popular resort towns.

itinerary.title: Cultural Heart
itinerary.desc: Visit Ubud, temples, and rice terraces.

destinations.name: Tokyo, Japan
destinations.longDescription: Tokyo, Japan’s busy capital, mixes the ultramodern and the traditional, from neon-lit skyscrapers to historic temples. The opulent Meiji Shinto Shrine is known for its towering gate and surrounding woods. The Imperial Palace sits amid large public gardens. The city's many museums offer exhibits ranging from classical art to reconstructed kabuki theater and modern anime.

itinerary.title: Tech & Art
itinerary.desc: Akihabara electronics and Digital Art Museum.

destinations.name: New York, USA
destinations.longDescription: New York City comprises 5 boroughs sitting where the Hudson River meets the Atlantic Ocean. At its core is Manhattan, a densely populated borough that’s among the world’s major commercial, financial and cultural centers. Its iconic sites include skyscrapers such as the Empire State Building and sprawling Central Park. Broadway theater is staged in neon-lit Times Square.

itinerary.title: Lady Liberty
itinerary.desc: Ferry to Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island.

destinations.name: Goa, India
destinations.longDescription: Goa is a state in western India with coastlines stretching along the Arabian Sea. Its long history as a Portuguese colony prior to 1961 is evident in its preserved 17th-century churches and the area’s tropical spice plantations. Goa is also known for its beaches, ranging from popular stretches at Baga and Palolem to those in laid-back fishing villages such as Agonda.

itinerary.title: North Goa Vibes
itinerary.desc: Check-in near Baga, enjoy water sports and nightlife.

itinerary.title: Heritage & Culture
itinerary.desc: Visit Basilica of Bom Jesus and spice plantations.

itinerary.title: South Goa Peace
itinerary.desc: Relax at Palolem beach and sunset cruise.

destinations.name: Kerala, India
destinations.longDescription: Kerala, a state on India's tropical Malabar Coast, has nearly 600km of Arabian Sea shoreline. It's known for its palm-lined beaches and backwaters, a network of canals. Inland are the Western Ghats, mountains whose slopes support tea, coffee and spice plantations as well as wildlife.

itinerary.title: Misty Munnar
itinerary.desc: Drive to Munnar, visit tea museum and waterfalls.

itinerary.title: Backwater Bliss
itinerary.desc: Overnight stay in a traditional houseboat in Alleppey.

itinerary.title: Colonial Kochi
itinerary.desc: Explore Fort Kochi, Jewish Synagogue and Chinese fishing nets.

destinations.name: Jaipur, India
destinations.longDescription: Jaipur is the capital of India’s Rajasthan state. It evokes the royal family that once ruled the region and that, in 1727, founded what is now called the Old City, or 'Pink City' for its trademark building color. At the center of its stately street grid (notable in India) stands the opulent, colonnaded City Palace complex.

itinerary.title: The Pink City
itinerary.desc: Visit Hawa Mahal and City Palace.

itinerary.title: Forts & Grandeur
itinerary.desc: Elephant ride at Amber Fort and sunset at Nahargarh.

itinerary.title: Local shopping
itinerary.desc: Explore Johari Bazaar for jewelry and textiles.

destinations.name: Ladakh, India
destinations.longDescription: Ladakh is a region administered by India as a union territory... It extends from the Siachen Glacier in the Karakoram range to the main Great Himalayas to the south. The region is known for its remote mountain beauty and culture.

itinerary.title: Acclimatization
itinerary.desc: Rest in Leh city to adjust to the altitude.

itinerary.title: Blue Waters
itinerary.desc: Day trip to the stunning Pangong Tso lake.

destinations.name: Manali, India
destinations.longDescription: Manali is a high-altitude Himalayan resort town in India’s northern Himachal Pradesh state. It has a reputation as a backpacking center and honeymoon destination. Set on the Beas River, it’s a gateway for skiing in the Solang Valley and trekking in Parvati Valley.

destinations.name: Udaipur, India
destinations.longDescription: Udaipur, formerly the capital of the Mewar Kingdom, is a city in the western Indian state of Rajasthan. Founded by Maharana Udai Singh II in 1559, it’s set around a series of artificial lakes and is known for its lavish royal residences. City Palace, overlooking Lake Pichola, is a monumental complex of 11 palaces.

destinations.name: Varanasi, India
destinations.longDescription: Varanasi is a city in the northern Indian state of Uttar Pradesh dating to the 11th century B.C. Regarded as the spiritual capital of India, the city draws Hindu pilgrims who bathe in the Ganges River’s sacred waters and perform funeral rites. Along the city's winding streets are some 2,000 temples.

itinerary.title: Evening Aarti
itinerary.desc: Witness the Ganga Aarti at Dashashwamedh Ghat.

destinations.name: Dubai, UAE
destinations.longDescription: Dubai is a city and emirate in the United Arab Emirates known for luxury shopping, ultramodern architecture and a lively nightlife scene. Burj Khalifa, an 830m-tall tower, dominates the skyscraper-filled skyline. At its foot lies Dubai Fountain, with jets and lights choreographed to music.

destinations.name: Singapore
destinations.longDescription: Singapore, an island city-state off southern Malaysia, is a global financial center with a tropical climate and multicultural population. Its colonial core centers on the Padang, a cricket field since the 1830s and now flanked by grand buildings such as City Hall.

destinations.name: Maldives
destinations.longDescription: The Maldives, arguably the ultimate island paradise, is a nation of tropical islands in the Indian Ocean. It is known for its beaches, blue lagoons and extensive reefs. The capital, Malé, has a busy fish market, restaurants and shops on the main road, Majeedhee Magu.

destinations.name: Santorini, Greece
destinations.longDescription: Santorini is one of the Cyclades islands in the Aegean Sea. It was devastated by a volcanic eruption in the 16th century BC, forever shaping its rugged landscape. The whitewashed, cubiform houses of its 2 principal towns, Fira and Oia, cling to cliffs above an underwater caldera.

itinerary.title: Oia
itinerary.desc: Explore the famous village of Oia.

itinerary.title: Beaches
itinerary.desc: Relax at Red Beach and Kamari.

destinations.name: Darjeeling, India
destinations.longDescription: Darjeeling is a town in India's West Bengal state, in the Himalayan foothills. Once a summer resort for the British Raj elite, it remains the terminus of the narrow-gauge Darjeeling Himalayan Railway, or “Toy Train,” completed in 1881. It's famed for the distinctive black tea grown on plantations that dot its surrounding slopes.

destinations.name: Mysore, India
destinations.longDescription: Mysore (or Mysuru), a city in India's southwestern Karnataka state, was the capital of the Kingdom of Mysore from 1399 to 1947. In its center is opulent Mysore Palace, seat of the former ruling Wodeyar dynasty. The palace blends Hindu, Islamic, Gothic and Rajput styles.

destinations.name: Rishikesh, India
destinations.longDescription: Rishikesh is a city in India’s northern state of Uttarakhand, in the Himalayan foothills beside the Ganges River. The river is considered holy, and the city is renowned as a center for studying yoga and meditation. Temples and ashrams (centers for spiritual studies) line the eastern bank around Swarg Ashram.

destinations.name: Gangtok, India
destinations.longDescription: Gangtok is the capital of the mountainous northern Indian state of Sikkim. Established as a Buddhist pilgrimage site in the 1840s, the city became capital of an independent monarchy after British rule ended, but joined India in 1975. Today, it remains a Tibetan Buddhist center and a base for hikers organizing permits and transport for treks through Sikkim’s Himalayan mountain ranges.

destinations.name: Hampi, India
destinations.longDescription: Hampi is an ancient village in the south Indian state of Karnataka. It’s dotted with numerous ruined temple complexes from the Vijayanagara Empire. On the south bank of the River Tungabhadra is the 7th-century Hindu Virupaksha Temple, near the revived Hampi Bazaar.

destinations.name: Ooty, India
destinations.longDescription: Ooty, also known as Udhagamandalam, is a resort town in the Western Ghats mountains, in southern India's Tamil Nadu state. Founded as a British Raj summer resort, it retains a working steam railway line. Stone House, a 19th-century residence, and the 1855 Government Botanical Garden are iconic landmarks. The town is surrounded by the Nilgiri hills and is famous for its tea plantations.

destinations.name: Tungnath Trek (Chopta), India
destinations.longDescription: Tungnath is the highest Shiva temple in the world and is the highest of the five Panch Kedar temples located in the mountain range of Tunganath in Rudraprayag district, in the Indian state of Uttarakhand. The Tunganath (literal meaning: Lord of the peaks) mountains form the Mandakini and Alaknanda river valleys.

itinerary.title: Chopta Arrival
itinerary.desc: Drive from Rishikesh to Chopta base camp.

itinerary.title: The Summit
itinerary.desc: Trek to Tungnath Temple and Chandrashila Peak.

itinerary.title: Lake Trek
itinerary.desc: Visit Deoria Tal and return journey.

destinations.name: Rameshwaram, India
destinations.longDescription: Rameshwaram is a town on Pamban Island, in the southeast Indian state of Tamil Nadu. It’s known for Ramanathaswamy Temple, a Hindu pilgrimage site with ornate corridors and huge sculpted pillars. Agnitheertham is a holy water body where pilgrims take a dip.

itinerary.title: Ghost Town
itinerary.desc: Jeep ride to Dhanushkodi and Lands End.

itinerary.title: Engineering Marvel
itinerary.desc: Dr. APJ Abdul Kalam Memorial and Pamban Bridge view.

destinations.name: Trivandrum & Padmanabhaswamy, India
destinations.longDescription: Thiruvananthapuram (or Trivandrum) is the capital of the southern Indian state of Kerala. It's distinguished by its British colonial architecture and many art galleries. It’s also home to the massive Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple, the world's richest place of worship, known for its intricate Gopuram and vaulted gold vaults.

itinerary.title: Beach Day
itinerary.desc: Relax at Kovalam Beach and Lighthouse.

itinerary.title: Backwaters
itinerary.desc: Poovar Island boat ride and mangroves.

destinations.name: Andaman & Nicobar
destinations.longDescription: The Andaman Islands are an Indian archipelago in the Bay of Bengal. These roughly 300 islands are known for their palm-lined, white-sand beaches, mangroves and tropical rainforests. Coral reefs supporting marine life such as sharks and rays make for popular diving and snorkeling sites.

itinerary.title: Port Blair
itinerary.desc: Arrival and visit to Cellular Jail Light & Sound Show.

itinerary.title: Havelock
itinerary.desc: Ferry to Havelock and sunset at Radhanagar Beach.

destinations.name: Coorg, India
destinations.longDescription: Coorg, officially known as Kodagu, is an affluent hill station in Karnataka. It is well known for its breathtakingly exotic scenery and lush greenery. Forest covered hills, spice and coffee plantations only add to the landscape.

itinerary.title: Misty Hills
itinerary.desc: Visit Raja's Seat and Omkareshwara Temple.

itinerary.title: Nature's Fury
itinerary.desc: Trek to Abbey Falls and visit spice plantations.

destinations.name: Jaisalmer, India
destinations.longDescription: Jaisalmer is a former medieval trading center and a princely state in the western Indian state of Rajasthan, in the heart of the Thar Desert. Known as the 'Golden City,' it's distinguished by its yellow sandstone architecture. Dominating the skyline is Jaisalmer Fort, a sprawling hilltop citadel buttressed by 99 bastions.

itinerary.title: Golden Fort
itinerary.desc: Explore the living fort of Jaisalmer.

itinerary.title: Desert Safari
itinerary.desc: Camel ride and camping at Sam Sand Dunes.

itinerary.title: Havelis
itinerary.desc: Visit the ornate Patwon Ki Haveli and markets.

destinations.name: London, UK
destinations.longDescription: London, the capital of England and the United Kingdom, is a 21st-century city with history stretching back to Roman times. At its centre stand the imposing Houses of Parliament, the iconic 'Big Ben' clock tower and Westminster Abbey, site of British monarch coronations. Across the Thames River, the London Eye observation wheel provides panoramic views.

itinerary.title: Thames Views
itinerary.desc: Tower Bridge and London Eye ride.
